summary: <summary>   <purpose>The directoryScanner.ts file provides a DirectoryScanner class that recursively scans a directory and its subdirectories, creating a hierarchical representation of the files and directories. It applies various filters and options to include or exclude files based on specified patterns and extensions.</purpose>   <key_components>     DirectoryScanner class, DirectoryNode, FileNode, ScannerOptions   </key_components>   <dependencies>     fs, path, directoryNode, fileNode, scannerOptions, directoryError, pathUtils, fileReader, ignorePatterns, includeExtensions, patternMatcher   </dependencies>   <unique_characteristics>     The DirectoryScanner class uses a set of ignore patterns and include extensions to determine which files should be processed. It also supports optional include patterns to further filter the scanned files. The class recursively scans directories and creates a hierarchical representation of the file system, including both files and directories.   </unique_characteristics>   <methods>     shouldProcessFile, createFileNode, scanDirectory, scan   </methods>   <exports if any>     DirectoryScanner class   </exports if any>   The DirectoryScanner class is a key component of the file system scanning functionality. It provides a flexible and extensible way to navigate and extract information from a directory tree, with support for various filtering options and a well-defined data structure (DirectoryNode and FileNode) to represent the scanned content. </summary>
